page.title: 01Caerhays - General Review
page.content: This area starts at Dodman Pt. where there are remains of an iron age promontory fort and goes along the coast to the unspoilt Hemmick Beach. Over the fields above Percunning Cove to the beautiful Porthluney Beach, which is overlooked by Caerhays Castle ,set among acres of woods and parks. Further along the coast is Portholland a small cove with a cluster of houses. The area is mainly farmland with farmhouses and hamlets at Boswinger, Penare,Treveor,Trevessen and Caerhays.There is a large Hostel and Methodist chapel.There is a village school built in 1969 and cricket ground.Much of this area is protected by the National Trust and Countryside Commissions in the Heritage Coast Project.So the coastal footpaths,tiny coves and sandy beaches can never be spoilt.
